title: The NYPD's First Fifty Years (2015).pdf Gooner
description:
The NYPD's First Fifty Years - Politicians, Police Commissioners and Patrolmen (2015).pdf Gooner

Publisher: Potomac Books (January 15, 2015)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 1612346561
ISBN-13: 978-1612346564

The New York Police Department is an iconic symbol of one of the worldâ€™s most famous cities. The blue uniforms of the men and women who serve on the force have long stood for integrity and heroism in the work to serve and protect the cityâ€™s residents. And yet, as in any large public organization, the NYPD has also suffered its share of corruption, political shenanigans, and questionable leadership.

 

In The NYPDâ€™s First Fifty Years Bernard Whalen, himself a long-serving NYPD lieutenant, and his father, Jon, consider the men and women who have contributed to the departmentâ€™s past, both positively and less so. Starting with the official formation of the NYPD in 1898, they examine the commissioners, politicians, and patrolmen who during the next fifty years left a lasting mark on history and on one another. In the process, they also explore the backroom dealings, the hidden history, and the relationships that set the scene for the modern NYPD that so proudly serves the city today
